hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class StateMachine.CompositeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.StateMachine.Vertex
      • hu.elte.txtuml.api.StateMachine.State
        • hu.elte.txtuml.api.StateMachine.CompositeState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelElement
    Enclosing class:
    StateMachine

    public class StateMachine.CompositeState
extends StateMachine.State
    Base class for composite states in the model.

    Represents: composite state

    Usage:

    As a composite state is a state, all requirements and restrictions hold to the usage of this class that are specified in the documentation of StateMachine.State if the opposite is not stated explicitly.

    A composite state differs from a state in that it may contain other vertices (subclasses of StateMachine.Vertex) and transitions (subclasses of StateMachine.Transition) inside it, with an obligatory initial pseudostate and initial transition (like in the case of state machines; see the documentation of StateMachine.Initial for details). After entering a composite state and executing its entry action, the container state machine will automatically step forward from the initial pseudostate of this composite state.

    The state machine may only leave a composite state through a transition that is from that composite state or any of its enclosing composite states. See the documentation of StateMachine.State for more information.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: disallowed
    • Define subtype: allowed

      Subtype requirements:

      • must be the inner class of a subclass of StateMachine or StateMachine.CompositeState

      Subtype restrictions:

      • Be abstract: disallowed
      • Generic parameters: disallowed
      • Constructors: disallowed
      • Initialization blocks: disallowed
      • Fields: disallowed
      • Methods: disallowed
      • Nested interfaces: disallowed
      • Nested classes: allowed, only non-static and extending either StateMachine.Vertex or StateMachine.Transition
      • Nested enums: disallowed
    • Inherit from the defined subtype: disallowed

    See the documentation of StateMachine for detailed examples.

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs
